did.unittitle: Socialist Party (U.S.) Membership Index Card Collection
did.abstract: The Socialist Party (U.S.) was founded in 1901, bringing together moderate socialists from the Social Democratic Party, and dissident members of the Socialist Labor Party. The Socialist Party (U.S.) Membership Index Card Collection consists of index cards listing the names and addresses of Socialist Party members by state.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection 2010.095.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Socialist Party (U.S.) was founded in 1901, bringing together moderate socialists from the Social Democratic Party, and dissident members of the Socialist Labor Party. In 1936 the ongoing differences between the "Old Guard" and "Militant" factions, resulted in a split, with the Militant group retaining the SP name and much of the membership, while the Old Guard faction retained most of the organizational and financial assets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consists of twelve inches of 3x5 index cards listing the names and addresses of Socialist Party members by state.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection, created by the Socialist Party (U.S.), was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
